revised_title: Developmental Stages and External Features of Lepidosiren paradoxa
tldr: The authors study the external features and developmental stages of the Lepidosiren paradoxa, a primitive fish-like amphibian. They describe the egg, gastrulation, and early larval stages, as well as the transition to the adult form. The research also discusses the evolutionary significance of external gills in vertebrates and their potential role in the origin of the vertebrate limb.
